definition: powerful individual, family or group/clique/(loanword) valve

sentences.english: The period of the Northern Warlords' rule over China was an era of a great change.
sentences.chinese: 北洋軍閥統治時期，是個大變局時代。

sentences.english: Beiyang government and Manjing government are corrupt.
sentences.chinese: 北洋軍閥政府及南京國民政府政治腐敗。

sentences.english: The government called out troops and policemen to suppress the demonstators and over thirty students were arrested.
sentences.chinese: 北洋軍閥政府出動軍警鎮壓，捕去學生三十多名。

sentences.english: The Northern Warlord government called out troops and policemen to suppress the demonstration and over thirty students were arrested.
sentences.chinese: 北洋軍閥政府出動軍警鎮壓，捕去學生三十多名。

sentences.english: Chapter 4 elaborates ethnic policies under the reign of the Northern Warlords Government.
sentences.chinese: 第四章爲北洋軍閥政府的民族政策。

sentences.english: He is very interested in the history of the Beiyang Warlords.
sentences.chinese: 他對北洋軍閥的那段歷史很感興趣。

sentences.english: Northern Warlords are a special military and political force in modern China.
sentences.chinese: 北洋軍閥是中國近代一支特殊的軍事政治力量。

sentences.english: In the reign of the Northern Warlords, with the frequent wars, education was stagnant.
sentences.chinese: 北洋軍閥統治時期，戰禍不斷，殃及教育。

sentences.english: Yeh Kai-hsin was a general on the side of the Northern warlords who fought against the revolution.
sentences.chinese: 葉開鑫是當時站在北洋軍閥方面反對革命的一個將軍。

definition: Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Huang Xing (1874-1916), revolutionary politician, close collaborator of Sun Yat-sen, prominent in the 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], murdered in Shanghai in 1916
Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
